page.title: 15HARNHAM VILLAGE,SALISBURY
page.content: A typical suburban housing area around a scattered village of Saxon origin.A few timbered buildings survive. Most is 20th C with a post-war council estate and a wide variety of private houses, with a price range Â£30 _ 100,000. It cannot expand North as river area is too soft, so most development is up the East side of Harnham Hill and a cross the main N-S road in East Harnham. The area has 2 grocers, 1 post-office, 3 garages, 1 hotel, 1 pub with restaurant, 2 homes for old people, Newbridge Hospital, ambulance station, church, chapel, primary school, playing fields, farms and areas of natural beauty. The Rose & Crown Hotel is a centre for local entertainment including drama and music. A small industrial estate provides some employment.
